dt: {bc}the ability to govern and discipline oneself by the use of reason
{bc}sagacity or shrewdness in the management of affairs
{bc}skill and good judgment in the use of resources
{bc}caution or circumspection as to danger or risk

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}prudentia{/it}, alteration of {it}providentia{/it} {ma}{mat|providence|}{/ma}
shortdef: the ability to govern and discipline oneself by the use of reason
sagacity or shrewdness in the management of affairs
skill and good judgment in the use of resources
